column3: This is a lovely place to walk. The ocean view extends to the horizon and sunsets are amazing. Just watch out for dog do on the grass. Many people walk their dogs here and some are not responsible enough to pick up after their pet.

column2: The views are out of this world!
column3: If you want the full California experience, Ocean Avenue is it. Beautiful colors, ocean air, spectacular views, well maintained walking paths, fabulous people watching. You can't go wrong here. So much to see and do and, best of all, it is FREE!
Santa Monica has some of the prettiest streets anywhere, and Ocean Avenue is certainly no exception.

We walked and drove along the Ocean Avenue and always liked it. There is no shortage of cafes and restaurants along the street. Parking was always found. Sunsets are enjoyable after parking the car or on foot. Homeless people and their homemade shelters can be a nuisance.

column2: It was shut down for a bike race
column3: So nifty how they shut down the street for a bike race. Really the only address in Santa Monica. The elec scooters didn't work though, they gotta work on that

column2: Drive or Walk from Santa Monica Pier to Venice Beach
column3: I walked from Santa Monica Pier to Venice Beach. It's not a short walk but very enjoyable. Beautiful scenery and great for people watching.
Very nice place to visit the California coast is beautiful! Drove to PCH from San Francisco to Las Angeles over five days.
The good mood in walking or driving this part of Santa Monica is always there, never mind how many times you did.

column2: Nice place to hang out, easy access, affordable parking
column3: The Santa Monica Ocean Park Beach is a few clicks south of famous Santa Monica Pier, a lot less crowded and pleasant. We drive down on a whim and park on the overflow temporary parking for $1 / hour for 2 hours. There is also an all day parking next to it. There is a nice and spacious park, restrooms and a lot of nice sandy beach accessible. The walking path is nice but watch out for bikes - these guys don't seem to slow down for anything.
Sweet place to stroll, read a book, walk your dog, have a picnic, feed the homeless, and enjoy the views
Beautiful and lots to see and eat. Close to Promenade. Hotels with beautiful views but pricey. Love walking up and down this strip.
Excellent walkways and very senic paths. Clean and full of sights to see along the beach. Very relaxing area to just soak it all it

I grew up in this area. It wasn't special until they put in the "Prominad mall" > Now it"s the place to spend a Saturday or Sunday They have many stores for shopping and many different types of restaurants and dinners. Its very popular and I feel real safe.. Around the closed street mall traffic may be congested.and need to find parking structure. Its a short walk to Santa Monica Pier. . There are carnival attractions and walk way along beach all the way to Venice beach . Its used by people on bikes and roller blades. Interesting place to people watch.

column2: great views, very good for a walk, although campers make it a little less than it should be
column3: great park for a jog along the top of the cliff, with access to the beach below in a couple spots. You can walk or job the sidewalk or fence path, too. Crowded, but not too much so. There are a number of people either living in the park, or sleeping under trees with all of their stuff during the daytime; unsure which.

column2: Buzzing area with a lot of entertainment/beach options
column3: Perfect for a day at the beach or a night out. Love this area! We spent the day walking the beach and hitting up the local events going down all through the area. Definitely a place to check out!
